fields.description:
Dear Sirs/Madams,
We had bought and setup JIRA Commercial License (500 users) on a server, but now we want to move this JIRA to other server. Could we install on new server and move the Commercial License to this server?
Please support us asap.
Thanks and Best Regards,
Do Xuan Hai
fields.summary: How to move the Commercial License to other server

fields.description:
I have a project where once the user's issue is created, they can't change the issue Title and Priority because there are other users issues in the project that they shouldn't change.  How can I give a user the ability to change a Title or Priority of an issue for which they created, without giving them the permission to change all issues in the project.

If we can do that, that would really help. 

Additionally, If we could also give that permission to an owner of a group of users, then they could change the title and priority for everyone in their group that create an issue, but not for other users issues.

Thanks,
Dave
fields.summary: Permission to change priority and title for tickets created by a user

fields.description:
When you drag an issue on a JIRA board and drop it onto another column the screen gets grayed out for a bit and there is an annoying delay. In Trello you can move cards however without getting such interruptions; JIRA boards should be as fluent to use.

I understand that the board's state should be persisted in the background, but I as a user really don't want to get interrupted and wait for the changes to happen. They can just happen in an invisible way and I only want to get interrupted if something goes horribly wrong.
fields.summary: Make moving issues in JIRA boards more fluent

fields.description:
When you have an issue open in the browser any changes that is made to the issue will be undetected for you: you need to manually reload the page to see the changes (you can rely on change notifications if you're watching the issue, but that is a delayed way of getting changes).

There could be a feature implemented that automatically refreshes the issue (I'm not thinking about a page reload, but rather just refresh the content, without loosing e.g. a comment that you're just writing) if changes were made by others. An alternative would be a notification similar to Bitbucket's pull requests: when a change occurs a small toast message will be displayed; when you click it the page will be reloaded.
fields.summary: Auto-refresh issue if it was changed (or e.g. comment added)

fields.description: As a Solution owner for big projects, I would like to have the ability to create a new custom text field for Acceptance Criteria, which would allow me to add test cases to my stories without cramming it up into the story description field.
fields.summary: Add custom 'Acceptance Criteria' filed in JIRA board

fields.description:
{panel}Original description by reporter -- Currently, if any issues in Sprint A in one board (Board A) got moved to Sprint B in another board (Board B), Sprint B will show up in the Velocity Report for Board A. 

It would be nice to limit sprints within a board in the Velocity Report. So no other sprints belonging to other boards should show up in the report. {panel}

h3. Summary

Velocity report include sprints from other boards. 

h3. Environment
* 2016-01-18 Cloud, 2016-02-01 Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Basically this might happen in the following scenario:
* You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint 1 with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. The Sprint 1 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.
* You have Board B with filter "project = B". You have Sprint 2 with issue B-1,B-2 inside it. The Sprint 2 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.

If issue A-1 is moved to Sprint B it means that Sprint B will contain 1 issue that match the filter of Board A, thus will make Sprint B APPEAR in board A. If that happen then the velocity report of board A will include Sprint B too. 

h3. Expected Results

Velocity Report should only show sprints from other boards if the issues were moved between active sprints, not in planning phase (between future sprints).
As moving issues to-from sprints affects velocity (committed/completed), the report should show it accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* The chart include Sprint outside the scope of the board, and Sprint might result empty. 

!velocity.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Velocity Report Should Only Show Sprints Related To The Current Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a new project based on an agile shared configuration yields a Software project with all the same schemes, but there is no board created, so it does not look like a Software project.

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-005 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project or have a previously created Software project available
# Create a new project based on a shared configuration
# Choose the previous Software project

h3. Expected Results
The new project should be created and an agile board should be visible

h3. Actual Results
The new project is created but only a list of issues is visible. When viewing the list of existing projects, the project shows up as a software project. When viewing the database, the project is listed as a software project.

{code}

 10628 | Something                     |     | emccutcheon |             | SOMETHING |        0 |            3 |  10011 | SOMETHING   | software
 10204 | Potato                        |     | emccutcheon |             | POTATO    |       10 |            3 |  10011 | POTATO      | software
 10629 | Project A                     |     | emccutcheon |             | ALPHA     |        0 |            3 |  10011 | ALPHA       | software
 10630 | Project B                     |     | emccutcheon |             | ANYTHING  |        0 |            3 |  10011 | ANYTHING    | software

(29 rows)
{code}

Above, successfactors.n2 was created based on the configuration APPLE is using. Marty Test Two was created based on the configuration Marty Test One is using. In both instances each project resulted in a business board.

Switching the project type to business and then back to software does not correct the problem. Switching the project to a service desk project does result in a service desk project board however. Switching back to software from service desk changes the board back to a business board.

h3.Workaround
In your new project, under the project avatar in the sidebar, click the "Create Board" link. Create a new scrum or kanban board for an existing project, and make sure your current project is selected. The board and backlog will become available in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Creating a new Software project with shared configuration should copy board configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a basic [Smart Commit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+smart+commits] is performed on an issue, there will be no Issue Updated notification triggered, unless there are commands added, such as {{#comment}}, {{#time}} or {{#transition}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Basic Smart Commit should trigger an Issue Updated event as well 

h3. Workaround
Add any command for the commit to trigger notification
fields.summary: Notification for committed changeset

fields.description:
Hello
This ticket is regarding "Software Simplified Workflow for Project RM" for https://harpercollinsuk.atlassian.net
Previously we had a workflow where once we create a ticket, the status would be "to do" (first screenshot attached- Jira ticket1110 harpercollins)

Now, the status "to do" was replaced by someone and is now labeled as "in progress'
I've tried to change this status back to "to do" but when I do it says there is already a status with this label/name.  (2nd screenshot- edit status)

When looking into the workflow scheme- it says this workflow is managed by Jira, Do not manually modify this workflow scheme.

+*(‘In  progress’ [with two spaces] needs to be changed to ‘To Do’)*+

+*Also it appears whatever changed also removed the following:
the other statuses that also no longer exist: “Awaiting review”, “Ready for Estimation”, and “Under analysis”.   
*+
We believe the updates maybe have been done by Donavan Grant in UK Harpercollins office. 



Could this have been updated by Jira software?

Please reach out to me asap as this is impacting many projects for HarperCollins.
914 299 0670 is my cell phone to contact me.   
         thanks
        Neeraj Sharma - 
Please cc grant.donovan@harpercollins.co.uk, and  fred.frenzel@harpercollins.com for any updates.
fields.summary: Jira workflow update affected all projects workflows

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing from JIRA Server to Cloud, if the JIRA Server has Agile in version with build number previous to '#45', the import will finish, apparently correctly, but with failed 'Software' features and alerting errors.
The following message is displayed in JIRA:
{quote}
JIRA Software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed.
Please contact your system administrator if you continue to see this message.
{quote}

The main concern is that for all the user knows, this import worked, as only errors in the logs are available, which are only accessible via Support. If the user misses or ignores the banner, they may insert new data and then a new import to fix this will make them lose the progress.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JIRA Server with Agile in version previous to build '#45'
# Do a full export and import in Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Importer warns that the import is not possible because the minimum version required for JIRA Agile is  6.7.12 as per [JIRA Agile 6.7 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.7+Upgrade+Notes]
Import process doesn't start

h3. Actual Results
Import process starts and fails. The site is locked.
JIRA loads an Access Error in the UI and the logs show:
{noformat}
Storing import result with error type: FAILED_VALIDATION
{noformat}

A few other times it may also show when starting JIRA after importing:
{noformat}

fields.summary: Importing from Server to Cloud or Upgrading to JIRA 7.1.0 from Agile earlier than build 45 is causing errors

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Version Report takes into account only the date when a Story is added to a version.
That said, if a completed story is added to a version the report will account the story points at the added date, not at the date the story was actually completed.
The story complete date is useful to track the team velocity, while the version added date does not seem to be useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be interesting to have this report showing the actual completion date Story instead of the date it was added to the version in case of a completed Story.
fields.summary: Version Report should better handle the Stories completion dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Sprint Burndown_ gadget gets truncated  when shown with other gadgets on the Wallboard view

h3. Environment 
- JIRA Agile 7.0.2
- Firefox 42.0
- Safari 9.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new dashboard
# Add _Sprint Burndown_ gadget and add _Version report_ gadget
# Change the header color of one of the gadget.
# Tools -> View Wallboard slideshow

h3. Expected Result

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

    Per documentation at [Ending a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-sprints/ending-a-sprint] , when ending a sprint, any incomplete issues should be moved to the next planned sprint if available. Otherwise, the issues should be moved to the backlog.

    However, when a project has multiple boards, and a sprint is completed from a board based on a JIRA issue filter, any incomplete issues not visible from that specific board are not moved to the next sprint, and are instead placed in the backlog. Only the incomplete issues visible to that specific board are moved into the next sprint.

    To reproduce,
#    Create a new project (e.g. TestProject)
#     Add 4 issues to the project, and assign 2 of them with a Labels value of A, and the other 2 with a Labels value of B
#     Add two sprints (e.g. Sprint #1, and Sprint #2), and place one issue with Labels = A and one issue with Labels = B in each.
#     Create and save a new Issue filter (e.g. Filter A): project = TestProject AND labels = A
#     Create a new board (e.g. Board A) in the project from an existing Saved Filter, using Filter A
#     Start Sprint #1 from any board
#     Complete Sprint #1 from Board A

    Results: The incomplete issue visible in Board A was moved to Sprint #2. However, in the default board, we can see the hidden issue was moved into the Backlog instead of Sprint #2.

h3. Suggested Solution

    Move all incomplete issues in a sprint, even those not visible in the current Board, to the next sprint when completing the Sprint, assuming there exists a next planned sprint. This will allow for more consistent, predictable behavior.

    For additional flexibility, provide the user a choice on where incomplete issues (visible and not visible to the current Board) should go. This is similar to the existing open suggestion: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6421

    If this behavior is not currently documented, update the "Ending a Sprint" article to elaborate on this behavior.    

h3. Workaround

    Avoid completing sprints from a board where issues in the sprint are not visible.
fields.summary: Hidden unresolved issues to move to the next sprint after completion

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
As of JIRA Agile 6.4.11, if someone uses the API (EpicService) directly to update an epic for an issue, no events are sent to EventPublisher. This is very bad for the plugins who depend on events to stay in sync with Agile board.

h5. Suggested Solution
I'm not sure if this is resolved in 7.0 (we still don't have access to the sources!), but if not – please consider implementing this. A GENERIC_EVENT or ISSUE_UPDATED would do.
fields.summary: As a developer of a plugin, I'd like to be able to receive an event when an issue is assigned to an Epic

fields.description:
Currently Jira doesn't allow you to graphically move issues between swimlanes, because it's said that it can't really tell what modifications are needed for an issue to meet a certain criteria for a swimlane, basically because they can be complex.

However, many times the conditions are not compex at all and they are based just on a one field filter. For example, if you have a swimlane for "priority = High" and other for "priority = Low", Jira could easily consider the lane as "switchable", because the only thing that it would need to do is to set the priority to Low or High depending on the swimlane. It could even detect ANDed conditions, like "priority = Low and assignee = Peter". Its obvious that for an issue to be there it has to meet both conditions, and it's obvious for Jira what to do (set priority to Low and assignee to Peter). 

Different are the cases where conditions are ORed or lists of values are used, but for many, many of the cases, this could be achieved quite easily.

Thanks.
Regards.
fields.summary: Switchable swimlanes for simple conditions.

fields.description:
With the addition of the Dev Panel, it seems that Bitbucket doesn't send anymore responses to the Source Tab if a Fisheye integration is still present. Instead it leaves an error message within the Source Tab above the Fisheye information as such: {code}This list may be incomplete, as errors occurred whilst retrieving source from linked applications:
Request to http://<stash-url>:<port> failed: Failed to parse the response from Stash: null{code}

However, the Development Panel works fine as suspected.

*Steps to test:*
# Created AppLink between JIRA 6.4.5 and Bitbucket Server 4.0.3.
# I had an AppLink already created to a FishEye instance - so I had the Source and Reviews tabs showing up in a JIRA issue.
# Committed something to my Bitbucket repo, referencing a JIRA issue created for testing.

*Results*
Development Panel works fine, but the Source tab shows a "null" result when trying to get information from Bitbucket.


*Additional Info:*
Fisheye was only mentioned because that's the only way we found the Source tab to be present.


*Resolution*
Support for Bitbucket Server was added in JIRA FishEye Plugin 6.3.10. JIRA 6.3.x and 6.4.x users can get the upgrade either:
# Downloading it from [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin].
# Or using the 'upgrade' functionality on the 'Manage add-ons' page.
fields.summary: Friendlier Message for JIRA & Bitbucket Integration Within the Source Tab

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Board is configured based on filter. If two boards are referring to the same set of issues being retrieved. Thus, the information of the sprints will also be shown on both of the boards (sprints that are associated with the retrieved issues). Applying changes in one sprint of one of the board will be applied to the same sprint in other board

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to make board independent, even if both boards are referring to the same JQL board filter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you use the Epic Link criteria in Basic search mode in the Issue Navigator and start typing in Epic names, the number of results that are returned in the suggestions are much more limited than what you would see of you were writing a JQL statement with the Epic Link field in the Advanced mode.  

!EpicLinkSearching2.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Basic Search, select Epic Link and start typing the name of an Epic (you must have multiple epics already configured and stories assigned to those epics.  It helps to have the Epic Names have a shared letter in them like "s")
# Note the number of epics that are returned in the search element's suggestions.

h3. Expected Results
The customer expects that there would be the same number of suggestions returned as one would see if they were perfoming a search via JQL in Advanced Mode (ex Epic Link = "epic name")

h3. Actual Results
The search critieria element only returns one suggestion
 

h3.Workaround
There is no equivalent workaround.  Asking users to simply use the Advanced mode over the Basic mode belies the original intent of a Basic search.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like Basic Search to return more suggestions for Epic Link.

fields.description:
when moving an issue from an active sprint on one agile board (call it ‘board A’) directly to another agile board (‘board B’) jira "links" the two boards and will show Board B’s sprint on the Board A backlog view. When Board A is closed, it will also add a Board B data point on the Board A velocity chart. This happens whether the boards are pulling from the same project or completely different projects. I can’t see any cases where a user would want this.

The work around:
When needing to move a story from an active sprint on one agile board to an active sprint on another agile board, drag the issue from Board A’s active sprint into Board A’s backlog.
‘Move’ issue from Board A’s backlog to Board B’s backlog. 
The drag the issue from Board B’s backlog to Board B’s active sprint. 
This is the only correct way I know of for executing a “move” of one issue in an active sprint on one Board to another Board without "linking" the boards and messing up reporting.

The “Fix” if you have this issue:
If the 2 boards have already been “linked”, then you may have to try a few things to decouple them. I’ve decoupled these multiple times and it seems that the specific sequence may depend on a few things. Generally you must move the offending tickets back to one of the board’s backlog (you’ll need a little trial and error to figure out which backlog to move them into), confirm that the boards are no longer linked, then move them back to where you ultimately need them.
fields.summary: another team’s sprint suddenly start showing up on my team sprint board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12690].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Display URL is not being used if creating a confluence page from Sprint report.

h3. Environment
* Confluence v5.8.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new application link from JIRA to Confluence.
# Edit Display URL on JIRA and Confluence.
# Go to any Sprint Report > click linked pages link.
# Click on the create page button and JIRA will directed to Confluence based on the "Application URL" instead of "Display URL".

h3. Expected Results

After clicked on the create page button, JIRA should directed to Display URL.

h3. Actual Results

After clicked on the create page button, JIRA is directed to Application URL.
 
h3. Notes

This problem doesn't affect "Link page" button function.

h3.Workaround

Change Display URL to Application URL.
fields.summary: Display URL has been ignored when creating a confluence page from Agile reports

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
When viewing our scrum board we often have subtasks belonging to the same parent spread across the various columns. When the parent and the subtask aren't in the same column, it displays a little stub at the top of the subtask to say which parent the subtask belongs to. This is great but it's still a bit tricky to visualise all the subtask that belong to a parent in this way when the board is busy.

h5. Suggested Solution
My thought for an improvement was that when you hover your mouse over either a parent or a subtask then all the other subtasks/parent are highlighted in some way so you can scan across the screen and see which subtasks are in which column for that parent issue alone.

The highlighting could be a subtle outlining of the related subtasks and issues or a dimming of the unrelated subtask and issues.

You could even have a context option over each to "Show only related subtasks" that would provide a kind of dynamic Quick Filter which would just show that parent and subtasks.

+note+ - this is not a problem when the rows are grouped per issue, but is when they're grouped per assignee.
fields.summary: Highlight-on-hover all subtasks of an issue on a Scrum board

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Currently a JIRA admin cannot add multiple working days on a single operation.

h5. Suggestion
As an admin, I want to be able to add a span of non-working days instead of having to enter them one-by-one.

For example, our company closes between Christmas and New Year's.  I want to be able to enter the 4-5 week days that are typically between those two days without having to click {{Add Date}}, select a day, and repeat until all of them are added.
fields.summary: Add multiple non-working days at once

fields.description:
When I am reviewing an Epic, would like the ability to rank an issue up or down from the "Issues in Epic" section. There is the ability to rank to top or bottom, but that does not work well with epics, which have lots of stories.

When I am reviewing a story, I can already rank subtasks up or down one at a time using the arrows- I'd request that functionality get imported to the Epic view.

Thanks,
Richard Pierce
fields.summary: Ability to rank an issue up or down from the "Issues in Epic" section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Backlog/Plan mode did not render any issues and throw 500/400 error due to corrupted index with Epic issue type.

Index can be corrupted at times and not all Enterprise customers can perform full re-indexing at any time of the day as it could take hours of downtime. While index is known to be corrupted, JIRA Agile should continue presenting/rendering Backlog so users can continue to work.

h3. Suggested Solution 
Continue to render Backlog with all other issues and pop-up warning of missing issues from matching index and database.

h3. Workaround 
* Perform single project re-index
* Perform full re-index

h3. Additional information
* Customer on JIRA 6.2.3 and Agile 6.6.0 when hit into the problem
* Tested locally deleting Epic issue via database on JIRA 6.4.5 and Agile 6.7.11
fields.summary: Backlog to Continue render with Corrupted Index

Actually, we would prefer showing some of the calculated fields on the details view, so if https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10191 gets implemented then this is not so critical.
fields.summary: More than 3 custom fields on kanban card

fields.description:
I would like to reopen this suggestion. Referring to: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3010

I would like the user stories that belong to an Epic to be prioritized (ranked) according to the Epic they belong to. So in practice, when you re-order the Epics on the Agile board, the User stories should follow. Currently it's easy to have confusing ranking as an Epic might be on top of the Epic list while the User stories belonging to the Epic are ranked on the bottom. It requires unnecessary manual work to keep these two aligned.
fields.summary: Prioritization of Epics should also prioritize the children issues

fields.description:
It would be useful data to display a stacked bar graph option to the velocity chart. 

The additional columns of data would encompass these:

||Sprint||Committed||Completed||Added||Removed||
|ABC-2015.41|40|39|0|0|
|ABC-2015.43|40|38|4|6|
|ABC-2015.45|42|39|25|28|

With this additional data, one can see 
 - good behavior (Sprint ABC-2015.41) where the scope of the sprint was unchanged
 - typical behavior (Sprint ABC-2015.43) where there is a little give and take in the scope
 - bad behaviors (Sprint ABC-2015.45) where there is just whole scale churn in the scope of what the team is working on. 

To implement this enhancement, I would propose the velocity report includes the two additional columns in the tabulated data presentation AND the current completed bar on the graph become a stacked bar graph element. That stacked bar element would have a total height equal to the Completed total and an internal segment drawn in an contrasting color equal to the Added total. That Added total does not increase the height of the Completed bar, it simply segments the data.
fields.summary: Enhancement Request: Add stacked bar data to Velocity charts for stories added and ejected from sprints

fields.description:
The switch to Jira Software provides no way for users to create a new project and manually assign screens, schemes, and workflows as was possible in the previous version. Currently, users are forced to select a Jira Software or Jira Business option that will automatically create a new series of screens, schemes, and workflows for the project. This is problematic for users who have created their screens, schemes, and workflows ahead of time and simply wish to assign them to a new project. As it stands, the user can assign their custom screens, schemes, and workflows but must then go through extra steps to delete the unnecessary screens, schemes, and workflows that Jira Software automatically creates based on the options presented upon project creation.  

While users can certainly edit the series of screens, schemes, and workflows automatically created for a new project, problems still exist with that approach. For example, since an active workflow cannot be renames, the process to simply rename the automatically created workflow becomes drawn out i.e. unassign, rename, reassign OR create and assign a new workflow.

In short, there should be an option to manually select the screens, schemes, and workflows for a new project and users should not be forced into automatically created options. If a user already has screens, schemes, and workflows made and configured the way they want, then what's the point of forcing them to use pre-made options that they're just going to delete anyway? Re-adding an option to manually assign screens, schemes, and workflows during project creation will go a long way toward catering to a wider range of users and maintains the flexibility that users come to depend on with Jira.
fields.summary: Option to Manually Select Screens, Schemes, and Workflows for New Proejcts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agile related gadgets will not show up in the System Dashboard for users not logged in even though the project and filter are set to be shown to anyone/everyone

h3. Environment
{{JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-001}}
{{JIRA Server 7.0.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and set the browse permissions to the group (anyone)
# Create a board based on the newly created project
# Go to newly created board then click on Configure > Edit Filter Shares > Add Everyone
# Go to System > System Dashboard and add agile related gadgets such as "sprint health"
# Log out and go to your homepage

h3. Expected Results
Gadgets will show up for users not logged in

h3. Actual Results
Gadgets will not show up 

h3. Notes
In JIRA Server 6.4.6, agile related gadgets will show up for users not logged in
In JIRA Server 7.0.0, agile related gadgets will not show up for users not logged in

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: Agile Related Gadgets On System Dashboard Do Not Show Up For Non-JIRA Users (Anonymous)

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, some Agile custom fields such Epic Link, Epic Name, Srpint, Rank, etc are *locked*, as they are the main custom field in JIRA Agile, and we would like to prevent the human error of mistakenly deleting or editing them. However, other main custom field such as Story Point, is not locked. When the user is not familiar with the main field in JIRA Agile (since it's listed as custom field), the user could delete it, and lose the data or this field's values, which will be a huge impact for the user's Agile data. Especially if this is highly being referred by the stories in JIRA Agile.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the JIRA Agile custom fields are all locked. So this will be helpful for the user in the following scenarios:
* User would know that these are the automatically created custom fields by JIRA Agile
* These are most likely used by the team while working with JIRA Agile
* Prevent human error of mistakenly deleting it
fields.summary: All JIRA Agile custom fields should be locked

fields.description:

h5. Suggested Solution
Allow a board or JIRA administrator to recover deleted boards (or at least the most recent ones).
fields.summary: Ability to recover deleted JIRA Software boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Software allows the *Epic Status* field to be edited, which causes a *NullPointerException* when running calling:
* {code:none}GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/epic/{epicId}/issue{code}
* {code:none}GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/sprint/{sprintId}/issue{code}

as {{EpicServiceImpl.getEpicStatusValue(issue)}} expects an *Epic Status* to exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic and browse to it.
# Select 'Edit';
_alternatively, Select 'Admin > Add Field'_
# Edit the *Epic Status* to none

h3. Expected Results
* It would not be possible to change the *Epic Status* to {{none}};
* Or the endpoints wouldn't return a 500 error when parsing Epics with no statuses.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file or as a response on the API call:
{noformat}
2015-10-12 17:32:04,109 ajp-nio-8077-exec-2 ERROR matheus 1052x9377x1 13woces 192.168.10.96 /rest/agile/1.0/board/1/epic/10107/issue [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issuelink.EpicServiceImpl.getEpicStatusValue(EpicServiceImpl.java:221)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issuelink.EpicServiceImpl.getEpic(EpicServiceImpl.java:171)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rest.BoardEpicResource$2.apply(BoardEpicResource.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rest.util.IssueResourceHelper$1.apply(IssueResourceHelper.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rest.util.BoardResourceHelper.executeWithBoard(BoardResourceHelper.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rest.util.IssueResourceHelper.searchIssueByQueryParamsForBoard(IssueResourceHelper.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.api.rest.BoardEpicResource.getIssuesForEpic(BoardEpicResource.java:200)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	... 19 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:178)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:73)
	... 41 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.cors.CorsFilter.doFilter(CorsFilter.java:65)
	... 64 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:40)

h3.Workaround

{code:SQL}

{code}

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
The scenario is as the following:
* Parent issue A has 2 sub-tasks A1 and A2
* Parent issue A is in board A
* Subtask A1 is in board A
* Subtask A2 is in board B
* When subtask A2 is marked as _resolved_, a message will be prompted saying that Parent issue A will be marked as _resolved_ as well, eventhough subtask A1 is still an open issue

h5. Suggested Solution
Before closing the parent issue, JIRA Agile should be able to identify if there is any other open subtask, even in different board.
fields.summary: Parent issue should not be prompted to close when it has unresolved sub-task in other board

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1. Create a sprint with 2 stories with a few subtasks in each story. Set estimates on all subtasks. Start the sprint.
2. Check the burndown chart to verify that the number of hours remaining is correct.
3. Create a story in the backlog or a sprint that has not been started yet.
4. Move one of the subtasks from the current sprint from one of the stories. Choose change parent and select the story you created in the not started sprint / backlog.
5. The subtask is moved out of the current sprint / story, but the remaining hours in the burndown report is not updated with the hours moved out.

As a workaround I must always set remaining time for the subtask to 0 before moving, and then increase it again after it has been moved. If I forget this I am always confused and have to use more time than necessary on my reporting.
fields.summary: Moving a subtask out of a sprint does not update remaining time in burndown
Days in column is cumulative

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Enterprise customers have many Github organizations and they are added and changed frequently.  Every organization must be added individually which is a lot of work.

For example, in a recent ticket a customer has 80 Github organizations.  That's a lot of repetitive work.

h3. Suggested Solution

There are a number of possible solutions.
* Provide a control to configure which repos will be synced (all, owner, member)
* Sync all repositories where the linked account has "member" access.

It may be possible to switch the API call JIRA makes to list repos:
https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#list-user-repositories
| type |string | Can be one of all, owner, member. Default: owner
 
h3. Workaround

Repeat all steps to link an account for every Github organization.
fields.summary: Enable sync of Github repositories that a linked account has access to

fields.description:
When doing planning we use themes to track the different types of work we are doing.  To do this we have co-opted epics to display and filter on this information easily.  This means that we can no longer easily use epics for their original purpose of decomposing large stories.

My suggestion would be to add an additional panel, similar to Version and Epics for adding and sorting into Themes.

The other possible solution for this is to allow placing a story into more than one epic.  This way a story could be part of it's correct Theme and traditional definition of Epic.
fields.summary: Allow themes to be properly represented on the agile backlog

In most of the other fields I've worked with (e.g., JQL search) typing a field name will create a drop-down menu of options.  The _Change Sprint_ field should do this as well.

BTW, I use the JQL search to determine the Sprint ID for the _Bulk Change_ screen; this is a really clunky work-flow.

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
If I close the Detail view of the an issue while on a Kanban board, the Detail view will pop open every time I click on any other issue.  Sometimes I want it to stay closed so that I can work my board.  When I am on my desktop computer with a big monitor it is not much of a problem.  But when I am on a laptop with a small screen , it is a major pain to keep closing the issue Detail view when I click on any issue just to move it.  It should stay closed if the user specifically closed it.
fields.summary: Kanban Detail View needs to stay close

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using the [JIRA Agile Release Hub|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/checking-the-progress-of-a-version-701268829.html] provides interesting statistics and valuable data on the status of a project. Much of this information can similarly be achieved through the use of JQL filters that determine the status of issues. 

Warnings would be useful to report on and perhaps see inside of Conflunce, or across multiple projects. JQL functionality to get this information would be useful for Project Managers, and Developers who want to see this information.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create some simple to use JQL functions that report the warnings of an issue similar to the Release Hub, but across project.
 
h3. Workaround 
In recent versions of JIRA (6.4+)
It may be possible to use a filter such as: 
{{project = JIRA and status = RESOLVED and issue.property[development].openprs > 0}} for example to see open pull requests that have been resolved to meet this requirement.
fields.summary: Create JQL Functions of Release Hub Behaviour
